title: hardgranite
author: hardgranite
content: I just recently found out about Bitcointalk, and I heard its a really cool place to talk about different topics and bitcoin mainly. I currently invested around 1400USD in different cryptocurrencies. I came here to learn new things about crypto and meet new people. Cheers

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Welcome to the forum! You should read this thread Newbies - Read before posting so that ypu will be aware on the proper use of the forum. The rest of your questions can be find through using the search function. Limit yourself to create a thread without searching first for any duplicate thread since forum should be maintain clean as much as possible.Also, surprising that you already invested on crypto despite you are new here. I hope you are doing good with that investment. You should focus only in Bitcoin if you want a long term and less risky investment for your future.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: OP, welcome to this forum.Considering that you have invested a significant amount of money in crypto, I hope that you have analyzed the crypto market in detail beforehand and made your investment decision based on concrete indicators, and not based on the stories of others, which are often not true.As much as the crypto industry is an opportunity to make money, it is also a very risky investment in which many investors lose money.It's important to make a concrete investment plan and a clear exit strategy.Good luck with youir investment!If you need any advice feel free to ask and other members will answer you based on their experience.

comments.author: gantez
comments.body: You welcome to the forum. You have to know not to trust people you don't know. Always be doubtful when it is looking very promising when people offer you some help or talking on how to help to grow your investment. Do proper research before you do what you think you want to do, don't haste in decision. Just be careful and watch scam. Don't give information like password when you get such pm.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Welcome, OP, to the forum. I see you are not quite oriented to the rules of the forum. You have a lot of posts that go one after another, and this is not welcome here. I advise you to read the rules before posting anything.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0#post_rulesAnd it can also be understood that you are very excited about your investments, but to say that nothing bad can happen is very self-confident. There are stories on the forum that talk about how people lost their money from improper storage, as well as from a lack of patience during the fall in the price of bitcoin. Take an interest in such stories to understand what can go wrong.

Move it to cold storage on a non custodian wallet like electrum or Bitcoin core.â€¢ Did you only change the email address to a non personal one? Cause, I can still see an email address on your profile.How to change the feature; go to Account Related Settings on your profile and tick - Hide email address from public?.Quote from: hardgranite on December 10, 2022, 04:24:11 PM10% ETH, 5% XRP, 5% DOGE and 80% BTC80% Bitcoin is not a bad amount, I personally prefer all crypto investments being made in Bitcoin and diversifications should be to other industries, like tourism, stocks etc. But not everyone thinks that way.

comments.body: You're welcome, and it's great that you're here to learn more about bitcoin because there are some people who will be willing to invest but won't know much about it, and after they invest in some shady items, they'll complain that they were scammed.
